Class Pit

  • java.lang.Object
    • Pit

  • public class Pit
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents a pit for the board game Mancala. The Pit holds a number of Stones and manages them. A Pit also knows if it is a Mancala pit or a regular pit. Each Pit has a method for drawing itself, and uses a MancalaBoardLayout to determine how it looks.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Pit(MancalaBoardLayout appearance, boolean isMancala, int numStones, double xCoord, double yCoord)
      Creates a Pit prefilled with Stones.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Pit

        public Pit(MancalaBoardLayout appearance,
           boolean isMancala,
           int numStones,
           double xCoord,
           double yCoord)
        Creates a Pit prefilled with Stones. This Pit uses the given MancalaBoardLayout, x-coordinate, and y-coordinate. Whether or not this Pit is a Mancala pit depends on the value of the provided boolean isMancala.
        Parameters:
        appearance - the MancalaBoardLayout this Pit will use
        isMancala - whether or not this pit is a Mancala pit
        numStones - the initial number of Stones in this Pit
        xCoord - the x-coordinate of this Pit's top left corner
        yCoord - the y-coordinate of this Pit's top left corner

    • Method Detail

      • draw

        public void draw(java.awt.Graphics2D g2)
        Draws this Pit and the number of Stones in this Pit. It draws a single Stone and a String underneath that shows how many Stones are in this Pit.
        Parameters:
        g2 - the Graphics2D that will draw this Pit

      • isMancalaPit

        public boolean isMancalaPit()
        Returns whether or not this Pit is a Mancala Pit.
        Returns:
        true if this Pit is a Mancala Pit, false if this Pit is a regular Pit

      • checkWithinStone

        public boolean checkWithinStone(java.awt.Point p)
        Checks whether the point is within the Stone of this Pit.
        Parameters:
        p - the point to compare with the Stone's location
        Returns:
        true if the Point is within the Stone, false otherwise

      • removeAll

        public int removeAll()
        Removes all the Stones in this pit.
        Returns:
        the number of Stones removed from this Pit

      • createCopy

        public Pit createCopy()
        Creates a shallow copy of this Pit. The MancalaBoardLayout of the copy is the same as the MancalaBoardLayout of the original.
        Returns:
        a shallow copy of this Pit

      • addStone

        public void addStone(int number)
        Adds a Stones to this Pit
        Parameters:
        number - the number of Stones to add to this Pit

      • countStones

        public int countStones()
        Returns the number of Stones in this Pit
        Returns:
        the number of Stones in this Pit

        public void setXCoord(double xCoord)
        Sets the x-coordinates of this Pit's top left corner.
        Parameters:
        xCoord - the new x-coordinate of this Pit's top left corner

        Returns:
